info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 13 at 8:52PM EDT until May 13 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh PA
info.description:
At 852 PM EDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area over the next hour. Flash flooding is already occurring, with multiple reports of water over roadways between Zanesville and Dresden.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Emergency management reported.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Zanesville, South Zanesville, North Zanesville, Dresden, Frazeysburg, Fultonham, Drake, East Fultonham and Dillon State Park.
Additional locations include State Road 60 and Dresden Road between Zanesville and Dresden, both of which have water over the road in spots per recent reports.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN COSHOCTON AND WESTERN MUSKINGUM COUNTIES
